FragilityCurve.Description: Costing for each 100 ft^2 Wall Panel. Assumed framing: 1 SIDE: 3/8" OSB or 15/32 ply with 8d box nails at 4 to 6 inches along panel edges and 12 inches field nailing. DF #2, 2x4@16 studs. 1 SIDE: 1/2 gypsum board. Panel 8 feet tall, 8 or 16 feet long with or without door and window openings, double top plate, single bottom plate, with hold-downs.
FragilityCurve.Name: Exterior Wall - Light framed wood walls with structural panel sheathing, gypsum wallboard and hold-downs
FragilityCurve.Author: Andre Filiatrault
FragilityCurve.Notes: Copy of B1071.021 for use as an exterior wall. DamageState.Description: Slight separation of sheathing or nails which come loose.

ConsequenceGroup.RepairMeasures: Remove exterior pliable siding, replace loose nails, reinstall siding.

DamageState.Description: Permanent rotation of sheathing, tear out of nails or sheathing.

ConsequenceGroup.RepairMeasures: Remove exterior pliable siding, remove wood sheathing, install new sheathing, reinstall siding.

DamageState.Description: Fracture of studs, major sill plate cracking.

ConsequenceGroup.RepairMeasures: Remove and replace siding, sheathing, studs and plates. Provide shoring as required.
